avatar.name: Sparxie
avatar.description:
Like! Follow! Stream! Views! Party till the world ends!
Sparxie and Sparkle, the Mask and the Fool are fundamentally the same.
Whoever is seen, whoever is liked, is the correct answer!

skills.name: Cat Got Your Flametongue?
skills.description: Deals Fire DMG equal to ****1[i]%**** of Sparxie's ATK to one designated enemy.

skills.name: Boom! Sparxicle's Poppin'
skills.description: Start a livestream to turn Basic ATK into "Bloom! Winner Takes All" and trigger "Engagement Farming" 1 time. During this ability, "Engagement Farming" can be triggered repeatedly, up to **1[i]** time(s). Using this ability is not considered as using a Skill.

skills.name: Party's Wildin' and Camera's Rollin'
skills.description: Gains **1[i]** **Punchline** point(s). Deals Fire DMG equal to (**3[f1]** × Elation + ****2[f1]%****) of Sparxie's ATK to all enemies.

skills.name: Sleight of Sparx Hand
skills.description:
While Sparxie holds "**Certified Banger**":
Using Enhanced Basic ATK deals ****3[i]%**** Fire **Elation DMG** to one designated enemy, and ****4[f1]%**** Fire **Elation DMG** to their adjacent targets. Additionally, for every 1 instance of "Engagement Farming" triggered, the Enhanced Basic ATK deals 1 extra instance of ****1[f1]%**** Fire **Elation DMG** to 1 random attacked enemy target.
Using Ultimate deals ****2[i]%**** Fire **Elation DMG** to all enemies.

skills.name: Attack
skills.description: Attacks an enemy, and after entering combat, reduces their Toughness of the corresponding Type.

skills.name: Content Monetization
skills.description:
After using the Technique, inflicts enemies within a set area with "Block" for **3[i]** second(s). "Blocked" enemies cannot detect ally targets.
After entering combat via actively attacking a "Blocked" enemy, deals Fire DMG to all enemies equal to **2[i]%** of Sparxie's ATK and recovers **1[i]** Skill Point(s) for allies.

skills.name: Bloom! Winner Takes All
skills.description: Finalizes the livestream. Deals Fire DMG equal to ****1[i]%**** of Sparxie's ATK to one designated enemy, and Fire DMG equal to ****2[f1]%**** of Sparxie's ATK to adjacent targets.

skills.name: Engagement Farming
skills.description:
Causes "Bloom! Winner Takes All" to increase the DMG multiplier against one designated enemy by ****4[f1]%**** and the DMG multiplier against adjacent targets by ****5[f1]%****. Randomly gains one of the following gifts:
"Straight Fire": **3[i]** **Punchline** point(s) and **1[i]** Skill point(s).
"Unreal Banger": **2[i]** **Punchline** point(s).
Using this ability is not considered as using a Skill.

skills.name: Signal Overflow: The Great Encore!
skills.description: Deals ****2[f1]%**** Fire **Elation DMG** to all enemies and deals **3[i]** additional instance(s) of DMG. Each instance deals ****1[f1]%**** Fire **Elation DMG** to one random enemy. Grants **4[i]** "Thrill" point(s) to Sparxie, which can be used to offset Sparxie's Skill Point consumption. Consuming "Thrill" is considered as consuming Skill Points.

tree.name: Cat Got Your Flametongue?
tree.description: Deals Fire DMG equal to ****1[i]%**** of Sparxie's ATK to one designated enemy.

tree.name: Boom! Sparxicle's Poppin'
tree.description: Start a livestream to turn Basic ATK into "Bloom! Winner Takes All" and trigger "Engagement Farming" 1 time. During this ability, "Engagement Farming" can be triggered repeatedly, up to **1[i]** time(s). Using this ability is not considered as using a Skill.

tree.description: Gains **1[i]** **Punchline** point(s). Deals Fire DMG equal to (**3[f1]** × Elation + ****2[f1]%****) of Sparxie's ATK to all enemies.

tree.name: Sleight of Sparx Hand
tree.description:
While Sparxie holds "**Certified Banger**":
Using Enhanced Basic ATK deals ****3[i]%**** Fire **Elation DMG** to one designated enemy, and ****4[f1]%**** Fire **Elation DMG** to their adjacent targets. Additionally, for every 1 instance of "Engagement Farming" triggered, the Enhanced Basic ATK deals 1 extra instance of ****1[f1]%**** Fire **Elation DMG** to 1 random attacked enemy target.
Using Ultimate deals ****2[i]%**** Fire **Elation DMG** to all enemies.

tree.description:
After using the Technique, inflicts enemies within a set area with "Block" for **3[i]** second(s). "Blocked" enemies cannot detect ally targets.
After entering combat via actively attacking a "Blocked" enemy, deals Fire DMG to all enemies equal to **2[i]%** of Sparxie's ATK and recovers **1[i]** Skill Point(s) for allies.

tree.name: Sweet! Punchline Signing
tree.description: For every **100** of Sparxie's ATK that exceeds **2000**, increases this unit's Elation by **5%**, up to a maximum increase of **80%**.

tree.name: Dazzling! Persona Kaleidoscope
tree.description: When there are 1/2/(3 or more) Elation characters in the team, using Sparxie's Ultimate will additionally gain **2**/**4**/**8** **Punchline** and **1**/**1**/**4** "Thrill".

tree.name: Frenzy! Palette of Truth and Lies
tree.description: For every 1 **Punchline** currently owned, increases all allies' CRIT DMG by **8%**, up to a max increase of **80%**.

tree.name: Signal Overflow: The Great Encore!
tree.description: Deals ****2[f1]%**** Fire **Elation DMG** to all enemies and deals **3[i]** additional instance(s) of DMG. Each instance deals ****1[f1]%**** Fire **Elation DMG** to one random enemy. Grants **4[i]** "Thrill" point(s) to Sparxie, which can be used to offset Sparxie's Skill Point consumption. Consuming "Thrill" is considered as consuming Skill Points.

ranks.name: #GoingViral #WhoIsShe
ranks.description: When Aha Instant ends, gains <unbreak>#1[i]</unbreak> <u>Punchline</u>. For every 1 <u>Punchline</u> owned, increases All-Type <u>RES PEN</u> for all allies by <unbreak>#2[f1]%</unbreak>, up to a max increase of <unbreak>#3[i]%</unbreak>.

ranks.name: #AudienceKnows
ranks.description: When Aha Instant ends, Sparxie gains 1 <u>extra turn</u> and <unbreak>#1[i]</unbreak> "Thrill." For every 1 "Thrill" consumed, increases this unit's CRIT DMG by <unbreak>#2[i]%</unbreak>, lasting for <unbreak>#3[i]</unbreak> turn(s) and stacking up to <unbreak>#4[i]</unbreak> time(s).

ranks.name: #LinkUp #HeartSkip
ranks.description: Skill Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. <unbreak>15</unbreak>.\nBasic ATK Lv. +1, up to a maximum of Lv. <unbreak>10</unbreak>.\nElation Skill Lv. +1, up to a maximum of Lv. <unbreak>15</unbreak>.

ranks.name: #LockedIn #FaceCard
ranks.description: When using Ultimate, additionally gains <unbreak>#1[i]</unbreak> <u>Punchline</u> and increases this unit's Elation by <unbreak>#2[i]%</unbreak> for <unbreak>#3[i]</unbreak> turn(s).

ranks.name: #HealingTheWorld #GoodVibesOnly
ranks.description: Ultimate Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. <unbreak>15</unbreak>.\nTalent Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. <unbreak>15</unbreak>.\nElation Skill Lv. +1, up to a maximum of Lv. <unbreak>15</unbreak>.

ranks.name: #BuiltDifferent #GoingExtinct
ranks.description: Increases All-Type <u>RES PEN</u> by <unbreak>#3[i]%</unbreak>. For every <unbreak>#1[i]</unbreak> <u>Punchline</u> taken into account, the number of additional DMG instances dealt by the Elation Skill increases by 1, up to a max of <unbreak>#2[i]</unbreak>.

avatar.name: Yao Guang
avatar.description:
Mysterious, bold, radical... her quest for change is stunning.
With the "eye" of The Hunt, she sees all fates. Though she knows fate is immutable, the Seer Strategist still walks into danger alone.
With the odds stacked against her, how can she possibly change her destiny?

skills.name: Whistlebolt Sings Joy
skills.description: Deals Physical DMG equal to ****1[i]%**** of Yao Guang's ATK to one designated enemy and Physical DMG equal to ****2[i]%**** of Yao Guang's ATK to targets adjacent to it. The Energy regenerated from Basic ATK increases to 30.

skills.name: Decalight Unveils All
skills.description: Deploys a Zone for ****1[i]**** turn(s). While the Zone is active, increases all allies' Elation by an amount equal to ****2[f1]%**** of Yao Guang's Elation. After Yao Guang uses Basic ATK or Skill, gains ****3[i]**** <u>Punchline</u>.

skills.name: Hexagram of Feathered Fortune
skills.description: Gains ****1[i]**** <u>Punchline</u>. <u>Aha</u> immediately gains 1 <u>extra turn</u> where a fixed amount of ****4[i]**** <u>Punchline</u> is taken into account. This turn, does not consume <u>Punchline</u>, and increases all allies' All-Type <u>RES PEN</u> by ****2[f1]%**** for ****3[i]**** turn(s).

skills.name: Behold Wherever Light Unfolds
skills.description: When Yao Guang holds "<u>Certified Banger</u>": After an ally target uses an attack, triggers "Great Boon," dealing 1 additional instance of ****1[f1]%**** <u>Elation DMG</u> of the corresponding Type to 1 random hit target. If this attack consumes Skill Points, additionally triggers "Great Boon" 1 time. If the attacker's Elation is lower than Yao Guang's, this instance takes Yao Guang's Elation into calculation.

skills.name: Untethered Glimmer Sails Far
skills.description: After using Technique, automatically triggers Skill 1 time at the start of the next battle without consuming Skill Points. When Yao Guang is in the team, breaking destructible objects immediately grants Fortune Pouch, up to ****1[i]**** within every Earth Week.

skills.name: Let Thy Fortune Burst in Flames
skills.description: Inflicts "Woe's Whisper" on all enemies for ****4[i]**** turn(s), increasing DMG taken by ****3[f1]%****. Deals ****2[i]%**** Physical <u>Elation DMG</u> to all enemies, then deals ****5[i]**** instance(s) of ****6[i]%**** Physical <u>Elation DMG</u> to one random enemy.

ranks.name: Chuckle Chimes Where Jade Falls
ranks.description: In <u>Aha's</u> <u>extra turn</u>, the fixed amount of <u>Punchline</u> increases to <unbreak>#2[i]</unbreak>. When targets deal <u>Elation DMG</u>, ignores <unbreak>#1[i]%</unbreak> of the target's DEF.

ranks.name: Blind Arrows Guided by Feathers
ranks.description: While the Zone is active, increases all ally targets' SPD by <unbreak>#2[i]%</unbreak>, and additionally increases Elation by <unbreak>#1[i]%</unbreak>.

ranks.name: Auspices Mirrored In Decalight
ranks.description: Skill Lv. +2, Basic ATK Lv. +1, Elation Skill Lv. +1.

ranks.name: Threads of Fate Colored by Plumes
ranks.description: In <u>Aha's</u> <u>extra turn</u> triggered by Ultimate, the DMG dealt by all ally characters' Elation Skill becomes <unbreak>#1[i]%</unbreak> of the original DMG.

ranks.name: Bejeweled in Radiant Grace
ranks.description: Ultimate Lv. +2, Talent Lv. +2, Elation Skill Lv. +1.

ranks.name: Ferried Along the Astral Arc
ranks.description: All ally targets' <u>Elation DMG</u> <u>merrymakes</u> by <unbreak>#1[i]%</unbreak>. Increases the DMG multiplier of Yao Guang's Elation Skill by <unbreak>#2[i]%</unbreak> of its original multiplier.

avatar.name: Ashveil
avatar.description: An inquisitor from the Church of the Seven Gills. She wanders the fog-laden streets, seeking the 'Bait' that will lead her to the ultimate truth. To Ashveil, the world is but a banquet, and someone must always pay the check.

skills.name: Talons: Induction of Etiquette
skills.description: Deals Thunder DMG equal to <unbreak>#1[i]%</unbreak> of Ashveil's ATK to one designated enemy.

skills.name: Flog: Purge the Vile Beasts
skills.description: Marks a designated enemy as <u>Bait</u> and deals Thunder DMG equal to <unbreak>#1[i]%</unbreak> of Ashveil's ATK. If the target is already <u>Bait</u>, deals an additional instance of Thunder DMG equal to <unbreak>#2[i]%</unbreak> of ATK and recovers <unbreak>1</unbreak> Skill Point(s). While <u>Bait</u> is on the field, all enemies' DEF is reduced by <unbreak>#3[i]%</unbreak>.

skills.name: Banquet: Infinite Eucharist
skills.description: Marks the target as <u>Bait</u> and deals Thunder DMG equal to <unbreak>#1[i]%</unbreak> of ATK. Immediately launches <unbreak>1</unbreak> enhanced Follow-up ATK. Consumes all <u>Gluttony</u> stacks; for every stack consumed, deals 1 extra instance of Thunder DMG equal to <unbreak>#2[i]%</unbreak> of ATK to a random enemy.

skills.name: Rancor: Retribution in Kind
skills.description: When an ally attacks the <u>Bait</u>, Ashveil consumes <unbreak>1</unbreak> Charge to launch a Follow-up ATK, dealing Thunder DMG equal to <unbreak>#1[i]%</unbreak> of ATK and gaining <unbreak>1</unbreak> stack of <u>Gluttony</u> (Max <unbreak>#2[i]</unbreak> stacks).

skills.name: Devour: O Loathsome Hand
skills.description: Immediately attacks the enemy. After entering combat via actively attacking a Dazed enemy, deals Thunder DMG to all enemies equal to <unbreak>#2[i]%</unbreak> of Ashveil's ATK and grants Ashveil <unbreak>#1[i]</unbreak> Charge(s).

ranks.name: Beware: Wander Not in Full Moon
ranks.description: While Ashveil is on the field, increases DMG taken by all enemies by <unbreak>#1[i]%</unbreak>. When an enemy target's current HP percentage is <unbreak>#2[i]%</unbreak> or lower, the DMG they take increases to <unbreak>#3[i]%</unbreak>.

ranks.name: Knock: Where Snickers Echo
ranks.description: Increases Max <u>Gluttony</u> stacks to <unbreak>#2[i]</unbreak>. Talent Follow-up ATKs refund <unbreak>#1[i]%</unbreak> of consumed stacks.

ranks.name: Hush: Weight of Unspoken Truths
ranks.description: Ultimate Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. <unbreak>15</unbreak>.\nBasic ATK Lv. +1, up to a maximum of Lv. <unbreak>10</unbreak>.

ranks.name: Heed: Truth Needs No Mastication
ranks.description: Using Ultimate increases this unit's ATK by <unbreak>#1[i]%</unbreak> for <unbreak>#2[i]</unbreak> turn(s).

ranks.name: Advisory: The Sleuth Is But the Slayer
ranks.description: Skill Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. <unbreak>15</unbreak>.\nTalent Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. <unbreak>15</unbreak>.

ranks.name: Finale: And Then There Were None
ranks.description: While <u>Bait</u> is present, reduces All-Type RES of all enemies by <unbreak>#1[i]%</unbreak>. Additionally, for every 1 stack of <u>Gluttony</u> owned, increases Ashveil's DMG by <unbreak>#2[f1]%</unbreak>.

weapon.name: Sneering
weapon.refinements: When Aha Instant is activated, the wearer's Elation increases by <color=#f29e38ff><unbreak>#1[i]%</unbreak></color>, lasting until Aha Instant ends.

weapon.name: Lingering Tear
weapon.refinements: When the Punchline held is <unbreak>#1[i]</unbreak> or more, the wearer's CRIT DMG increases by <color=#f29e38ff><unbreak>#2[i]%</unbreak></color>.

weapon.name: Mushy Shroomy's Adventures
weapon.refinements: Increases the wearer's Elation by <color=#f29e38ff><unbreak>#1[i]%</unbreak></color>. When the wearer uses an Elation Skill, increases Elation DMG taken by all enemies by <color=#f29e38ff><unbreak>#2[i]%</unbreak></color> for <unbreak>#3[i]</unbreak> turn(s).

weapon.name: Today's Good Luck
weapon.refinements: Increases the wearer's CRIT Rate by <color=#f29e38ff><unbreak>#1[i]%</unbreak></color>. When the wearer uses an Elation Skill, increases Elation by <color=#f29e38ff><unbreak>#2[i]%</unbreak></color>, stacking up to <unbreak>#3[i]</unbreak> times.

weapon.name: Dazzled by a Flowery World
weapon.refinements: Increases the wearer's CRIT DMG by <color=#f29e38ff><unbreak>#1[i]%</unbreak></color>. While the wearer is on the field, for every 1 Elation character in the team, increases the Skill Point upper limit by <unbreak>#2[i]</unbreak>, up to a max increase of <unbreak>#3[i]</unbreak>. For every 1 Skill Point the wearer consumes, enables the Elation DMG dealt by this unit to ignore <color=#f29e38ff><unbreak>#6[f1]%</unbreak></color> of enemy targets' DEF, stacking up to <unbreak>#5[i]</unbreak> times. If <unbreak>#7[i]</unbreak> or more Skill Points are consumed in the same turn, the wearer gains "Stream Promo," which increases all allies' Elation by <color=#f29e38ff><unbreak>#4[i]%</unbreak></color>. Light Cone effects of the same type cannot stack.

weapon.name: When She Decided to See
weapon.refinements: Increases the wearer's SPD by <color=#f29e38ff><unbreak>#1[i]%</unbreak></color>. When the wearer enters combat or uses Ultimate on an ally target, the wearer gains "Great Fortune" for <unbreak>#4[i]</unbreak> turn(s). While the wearer holds "Great Fortune," all allies' CRIT Rate increases by <color=#f29e38ff><unbreak>#2[i]%</unbreak></color>, CRIT DMG increases by <color=#f29e38ff><unbreak>#3[i]%</unbreak></color>, and the wearer's Energy Regeneration Rate increases by <color=#f29e38ff><unbreak>#5[i]%</unbreak></color>.\nAt the start of each wave, the wearer regenerates a fixed amount of <unbreak>#6[i]</unbreak> Energy.

item.name: The Fluffy Hand-drawn Storyboards
item.description: **Fluffy Across the Blue** in its storyboard stage. Slightly increases the Traces of **Elation** characters.

item.name: The Fluffy Serialization Memorial Issue
item.description: **Fluffy Across the Blue** currently in magazine serialization. Moderately increases the Traces of **Elation** characters.

item.name: The Fluffy Collector's Edition
item.description: **Fluffy Across the Blue**, now in published standalone volumes. Greatly increases the Traces of **Elation** characters.

item.name: Grit of Strife
item.description: Crimson crystal dust that Castrum Kremnos craftsmen use to coat their weapons. Slightly increases the Traces of **The Hunt** characters.

item.name: Resin of Valor
item.description: Crimson crystal amber forged by the craftsmen of Castrum Kremnos while tempering weapons. Moderately increases the Traces of **The Hunt** characters.

item.name: Lance of Retribution
item.description: A crimson spear forged from the lives and dignity of the craftsmen of Castrum Kremnos. Greatly increases the Traces of **The Hunt** characters.

item.name: Thunder Strum
item.description: A favorite instrument of the Rocking Rebels. An ascension material for Lightning characters.

item.name: Whimsy Wax
item.description: A Wishpower fragment from an imagenated creature. A crude material used for enhancement.

item.name: Dreamweave Steel
item.description: A Wishpower fragment from an imagenated creature. A normal material used for enhancement.

item.name: Lucid Awl
item.description: A Wishpower fragment from an imagenated creature. An advanced material used for enhancement.

item.name: Arcadian Token
item.description: A commemorative coin used within Planarcadia, commonly known as "Wishbae." Can be exchanged for rewards at Furbobocom News.

item.name: The Weight of a Reward
item.description: After obtaining Phone wallpapers, they can be changed in the Phone function.

item.name: Ah! Youth!
item.description: A headpiece modeled after the wispae "Golden Youth." People's regrets over unfinished business from their youth have coalesced into this little guy.

item.name: Sparkly Rabbit and Fire Shroom
item.description: Adorable headband styled after Sparkly Rabbit and Fire Shroom.

item.name: Loading
item.description: The classic "Loading" icon you see everywhere, now with some snazzy light effects.

item.name: Raccoon Supplicant Mask
item.description: An origami mask styled like a raccoon. Handle with care.

item.name: Phantasmoon: Blowing
item.description: Just a Phantasmoon blowing a party blower.

item.name: Power Token
item.description: Exchange tokens used in the Cosmicon Collective Store, each one a testament to your honor in battle.

item.name: Victorious Power Tokens
item.description: Special exchange tokens used in the Cosmicon Collective Store, issued during events to redeem content from Expansion Pack I.

item.name: Power Dust
item.description: The crystalline dust that drifts out after Cosmicon Collective duel. It is said to be the mark left by the dicerollers' conflicting wills. Collect a certain amount to give the cards you own a new glow.

item.name: Collective Experience
item.description: Use it to increase Experience Level of Cosmicon Collective. It represents a diceroller's combat Experience. The higher the Experience, the easier it is to earn respect from others, which is how the bracelet is passed down, after all.

item.name: Pixcoin
item.description: Gold Coins commonly found throughout Planarcadia. They can be exchanged for items, but there is a weekly cap on how many you can obtain.

item.name: Jewels of the Starry Seas
item.description: A precious treasure drifting in the endless sea of stars. Select one Light Cone of your choice.

item.name: Memo-Keeping Light Casket
item.description:
The container used by the Garden of Recollection to store Light Cones. You can choose to obtain one of the following 4-star Light Cones after opening it:
"Quid Pro Quo," "Fermata," "We Are Wildfire," "River Flows in Spring," "Past and Future," "Woof! Walk Time!," "The Seriousness of Breakfast," "Victory In a Blink," "Mushy Shroomy's Adventures"

item.name: Fortune All-In-One
item.description: Yao Guang's Fortune Pouch — May good fortune be with you always, come back soon!

item.name: Fateful Crossings: "Cosmicon, Roll On!"
item.description: A beautiful envelope containing a customized boarding pass. When used, you can choose any one from **22 4**-star characters.

item.name: Commencement Reception
item.description: A fine-looking envelope containing a custom-made ticket.

item.name: The Herta Contract: Special Pass Refill
item.description: A mutual aid contract between Herta and the Express. She will help the Express whenever she can, in exchange for treasures found during trailblazing.

item.name: "Trendy Headpiece" Giftbox
item.description: Use to obtain the Trailblaze Fashion "Loading"

item.name: Grudge Notebook
item.description: Upon use, allows all ally characters to restore HP equal to **50%** of their Max HP when their HP percentage is lowered to below **50%** for the first time in the next battle.

item.name: Steel Coil
item.description: Upon use, immediately causes all allies to lose HP equal to **40%** of their Max HP, and increases their Elation by **40%** for the next battle.

item.name: Conscience
item.description: Upon use, immediately heals one selected downed character for 5% of their Max HP.

item.name: Domesticated Comedic Angel
item.description: Upon use, immediately recovers 3 Technique Points for the team.

item.name: Anti-Meme Toy Box
item.description: Upon use, randomly applies 1 of the following effects to all allies in the next battle: increases ATK by **35%**; decreases ATK by **10%**.

item.name: Badge Battle Robe
item.description: Increase DEF of all allies by **25%** in the next battle.

item.name: Sparxie Unlimited Edition Collectible Plushie
item.description: Upon use, increases all allies' CRIT DMG by **24%** for the next battle.

item.name: Cold Joke
item.description: Upon use, increases Ice DMG of all allies by **16%** for the next battle.

item.name: Super Livestream Matrix
item.description: Upon use, immediately regenerates **30%** of Max Energy for a single designated ally.

item.name: Bottled Quantum Ghost
item.description: Upon use, decreases all enemies' SPD by **15%** for the next battle.

item.name: Sea Monster's Touch
item.description: Upon use, immediately causes all allies to lose HP equal to 5% of their Max HP, and increases their DEF by **40%** for the next battle.

item.name: The Fluffy Multi-Functional Fan Glowstick
item.description: Upon use, increases all allies' CRIT DMG by **25%** for the next battle. When an Aha Instant takes its first action, CRIT DMG is additionally increased by **25%**.

item.name: Balloon Furbo
item.description: A Treasure Gadget that can be used indefinitely. After use, 1 Basic Treasure's location will be displayed on the Planarcadia maps.

relics.name: Magical Girl's Shining Medal
relics.description: The magical girl's candy-colored bow hairpin, shining like a glittering medal.
story:
Before making the deal, the merchant is extra cautious, with vigilant bodyguards scanning the crowd for anything suspicious.
To work undercover in this decadent district, all magical girls must remain on high alert.

"This is no challenge for us Magical Girl Troupe."
Without their idol outfits, and with their perfectly disheveled hair, the magical girls instantly blend in with the crowd, infiltrating the city according to plan.
Under the dim lights, their candy-colored hairpins serve as their secret insignias to identify each other.
"Café team in position." "Crossroads team in position." "Target spotted."
...
"We are the messengers who protect all that is beautiful!"

"It's them! Those super-strong pretty girls!" wails one of the fleeing suspects, his face black and blue. "Now Big Bro's been caught too. They're gonna get a medal for this!"

Over time, hairpins gradually took on the true meaning of "medals."
Some magical girls would add a new bead to it after completing a mission, and they came to love this fashionable way of displaying their glory even more.

relics.name: Magical Girl's Protective Gloves
relics.description: Multi-functional magical girl gloves, combining entertainment and combat capabilities. Pure white hands, protecting everyone's wishes.
story:
Magical girls embody the beautiful wishes of Planarcadia, yet they walk closest to the grotesque.
Bizarre and dangerous imagenae, nauseating murder scenes, violent and unstable criminals... this is the daily reality they face.

After a day of grueling work, their pristine white gloves are smudged with dirt, dust, and blood, yet they must keep smiling.
"Come on, you're a magical girl, how can you talk to me with such a gloomy face?"
"A real-life magical girl, like in the comics! Are you working? Show me some magic!"
"What's the point? You're just part of the scenery."
...

Melancholy and despair gnaw away at the pure hearts of magical girls. According to a widespread urban legend, they'll suddenly vanish from their teams without a trace, becoming devils who hunt down their former companions.
But beyond these unverified ghost stories, there are indeed many heartbreaking stories about magical girls.

"A magical girl who left due to injury sobbed her heart out while downing drink after drink over her gloves!" the drunken Fool joked, "Because her digital pet died again!"
That digital pet was named "Dodo," left behind by her fallen team leader.
On her wrist rested a tiny grave, in honor of that magical girl.

relics.name: Magical Girl's Everdance Battle Skirt
relics.description: A customized multipurpose combat suit that doubles as an idol's performance miniskirt. Comfortable, lightweight, and stain-resistant.
story:
The magical energy of a magical girl comes from the Wishpower of the citizens. To maintain public support, magical girls often double as idols performing on stage.
But Planarcadia is never short of novel entertainment. Thus, even as a beloved classic icon for years, magical girls are also constantly innovating to stay in the spotlight.

They join livestreaming teams, collaborate with trendy works, and release more accessible songs... yet the audience clamors for more. More sorrow, more joy, more devotion, and anything else that will keep boredom at bay.

It all began with an unexpected incident: During a live show, several magical girls protected the audience from an evil imagenae, gaining an unexpectedly positive reception.
This gradually evolved into a staged spectacle: A group of magical girls, acting as villains, would interrupt the performance, only to be dramatically defeated by another group of them.
"They'll protect us, with their magical rocket launchers and magical heart lasers!" The audience's eyes sparkled with exhilaration and anticipation.

The laughter must not cease, and the joy must not falter. The girls' skirts whirl in a frenzy until the very last ounce of their strength is spent.
When the curtain falls, the crowd departs, delighted, and greedily awaiting the next spectacle of Elation.

relics.name: Magical Girl's Contract Boots
relics.description: First-class wear-resistant boots. True promises are built not on words, but on the steps you take to fulfill them.
story:
The Magical Girl Troupe promised the citizens of Planarcadia: Any crime will be dealt with in fifteen minutes.
This itself was no difficult task for magical girls, but sometimes, such promises became an excuse for others to toy with them for amusement.

"You really showed up! How about a photo, gorgeous messengers?"

Running without purpose drains one's strength, and protection without respect frays promises.
The boots, originally designed to be light for pursuing enemies, grew heavy with their dejection.

"To ensure we never miss a genuine cry for help, and to ensure we're always there when every second counts, we will never stop running," declared the leader of the Troupe. "But make no mistake: I will not let those who made a mockery of our promise get away with it."

Those who defiled the contract are as guilty as the traitors. Thus, the girls cast a spell upon their boots.
The next morning, a group of runners appeared in the streets of Planarcadia. Their faces were filled with terror, yet their legs carried them tirelessly onward, pausing only for those in need.

That is the magic called "The Promise," and it is also the first vow of all magical girls.

relics.name: Diviner's Extrapolation Jade Abacus
relics.description: The external jade abacus worn by Jingtian. Knowing well that human strength could never fathom fate, he used it to ceaselessly divine the future.
story:
For years, the jade abacus sat fixed upon his head as if it were a natural organ.
Threads of light meandered into his gray hair, merging with his very consciousness.
At a speed far beyond mortal limits, he interpreted vast streams of data, translating them into lucid hexagrams. Even in sleep, portents would flow into his mind as a parade of strange dreams.

Admiring his reputation as "The Divine Seer," students meeting him for the first time would often ask curiously:
"Master Jingtian, if the jade abacus is so miraculous, then surely, in time, it could lay bare all of the world's secrets?"
In response, he would often pose some puzzling questions:
"That depends on... what do you see it as?"
Many would flatter him to his face, only to be met with a silent smile and a gentle shake of his head. Yet among them, one particularly spirited young girl spoke with blunt honesty:
"It looks like... a shackle."

Instead of getting angry, he burst into hearty laughter.
For a distinguished diviner, the greatest peril is being trapped within the confines of his own extrapolation.
"If one believes solely in the jade abacus," he muttered, "how can one comprehend the will of fate?"
Yet years later, he chose a different path, the only one that destiny had laid before him.

relics.name: Diviner's Ingenium Prosthetic Hand
relics.description: After losing an arm on the battlefield of Thalassa, Jingtian crafted himself a prosthetic arm, which was as cold and precise as his divinations.
story:
At the Battle of Thalassa, the Yaoqing forces faced off against the borisin.
The newly formed "Deca-Light Reflection Barrier" produced a baffling prediction: instead of deploying the millions-strong and battle-hardened Yaoqing fleet, seek help from the distant Ebonpearl Fleet of the Xianzhou Fanghu.

This conclusion defied conventional military wisdom, and the generals, as expected, adhered to the former course.
The Master Diviner of the Yuque remained in the rear, delving into mystical calculations and presenting the results to the Arbiter-Generals as a foundation for their verdicts, as was customary.
But when the divination results clashed with rational expectations, he resolved to verify them personally.

Disguised as a traveling merchant, he infiltrated the water dwellers' camp.
When the borisin surrounded the water dwellers, he stepped in to save them, ultimately winning their trust at the cost of an arm. From them, he learned a secret that no data bank had ever recorded:
Stirred by the moon, the "Devil's Tide" would engulf the battlefield in a month. The Yaoqing army, deficient in naval combat, would surely fail to sustain their fight, leaving only the Fanghu's Ebonpearl Fleet, adept in water, with any hope of victory.

When he returned, a prosthetic hand had appeared beneath his sleeve.
Diviners of the Yuque had always cherished their hands, even applying ancestral protective hand balm after their divinations.
But having lost an arm, he could no longer perform his delicate calculations as before, and when rotating the astral charts, it would always emit a hollow sound.

That hand was always cold, just like his increasingly precise divination results.
He gradually saw the full picture of the path ahead, far more vast than he had imagined...
An inescapable destiny, with absolutely no possibility of change.

relics.name: Diviner's Astral Robe
relics.description: The standard-issue ritual robe of the Yuque Divination Commission is typically reserved for formal occasions. Due to its rare use, it still looks as good as new.
story:
With the demonic star Ketu Mirage looming overhead, the Xianzhou Fanghu was in imminent danger.
He knew the ominous prophecy from many years ago would eventually come true, but he never imagined it would manifest in this way.
He was pleased that his student had grown strong enough to protect the Xianzhou, even if it meant he had to use the Yuque's ultimate weapon, Cloudpeer Telescope, to send a distress signal to the Reignbow Arbiter.

That day, he wore a relatively new ritual robe over his pilot's outfit.
"Sorry, I'll leave it to you."
He entrusted his other outstanding disciple with extrapolating the Deca-Light Reflection Barrier, ensuring the Reignbow's Lux Arrow would land on schedule.
"A diviner needs no farewell, since we've already said goodbye countless times in the future we foresee."
After bowing to his colleague, he boarded the Navis Astriger, heading for the Fanghu.

Cloudpeer Telescope sent a signal to where Reignbow last left its traces.
In the deathly still air, he raised his eyeline, just as he had countless times before, to gaze at the stars above.
A point of light appeared in the sky, his ritual robe rustling in the gentle breeze. He squinted carefully to make it out, then smiled with contentment.
"I... can see it."

As the Lux Arrow roared through the sky like a blazing sun crashing into the earth, demonic stars, abominations, warriors, diviners... all turned to dust.

relics.name: Diviner's Cloud-Soaring Boots
relics.description: Cloud boots crafted by Jingtian allowed him to fly onto battlefields and gather information. They are now displayed in the Yuque's Divination Commission, serving as a testament to future generations.
story:
Relics of past Master Diviners are all preserved by the Yuque's Divination Commission.
Among such exquisite divination tools as the Ruyi scepter, celestial instrument, hexagram board... a pair of worn boots stands out conspicuously.

Whenever new blood joins the Divination Commission, their first stop is to come here and pay their respects.
Ever since taking office, the General known as Madam Yao has personally presided over such ceremonies.

Most of Jingtian's relics were destroyed on the battlefield, and not even his remains were left behind.
In life, he crafted these cloud boots to verify his divinations personally, allowing him to move freely between battlefields and gather information swiftly.
However, the General discovered for the first time that these cloud boots, which should never touch the ground, had become covered in fine cracks and wear marks from prolonged use.

"Even if fate is predetermined, a diviner has the duty to understand why it is so."

Her master's voice echoed in her ears once again.
Now, the cloud boots float and spin aimlessly in the air, like a child who has lost their father, lost and bewildered.
Do they yearn to journey even further? Do they long to continue treading across the sea of stars?

The diviners gazed at it, watching as it flew further and further away, becoming a tiny speck of light in their vision, finally dissolving into that vast expanse of darkness and starlight.
Just like the handwritten words engraved beside the relic...

"The path to the universe begins with a single step."

relicSets.name: Ever-Glorious Magical Girl
relicSets.four: The Elation DMG dealt by the wearer and their memosprites ignores **10%** of targets' DEF. For every **5** accumulated Punchline allies gain, the Elation DMG dealt additionally ignores **1%** of targets' DEF, stacking up to **10** time(s).
relicSets.fourpc: The Elation DMG dealt by the wearer and their memosprites ignores **1[i]%** of targets' DEF. For every **2[i]** accumulated Punchline allies gain, the Elation DMG dealt additionally ignores **3[i]%** of targets' DEF, stacking up to **4[i]** time(s).

relicSets.name: Diviner of Distant Reach
relicSets.four: Before entering combat, if the wearer's SPD is greater than or equal to **120**/**160**, increases the wearer's CRIT Rate by **10%**/**18%**. When the wearer uses Elation Skill for the first time in each battle, increases all allies' Elation by **10%**. This effect cannot stack.
relicSets.fourpc: Before entering combat, if the wearer's SPD is greater than or equal to **1[i]**/**2[i]**, increases the wearer's CRIT Rate by **3[i]%**/**4[i]%**. When the wearer uses Elation Skill for the first time in each battle, increases all allies' Elation by **5[i]%**. This effect cannot stack.

avatarIcons.description: Avatar reward obtained from Gift of Stardust.
